li.p: the vector equation \uvec{x} = \uvec{x}_0 + t\uvec{p}, where \uvec{x}_0 is a vector from the origin to a known point on the line, \uvec{p} is a known parallel vector for the line, \uvec{x} is a variable vector representing an arbitrary point on the line (again as a vector from the origin), and t is a scalar parameter that varies as the arbitrary vector \uvec{x} varies

the vector equation \uvec{x} = \uvec{x}_0 + s\uvec{p}_1 + t\uvec{p}_2, where \uvec{x}_0 is a vector from the origin to a known point on the plane, \uvec{p}_1,\uvec{p}_2 are known parallel vectors for the plane that are not parallel to each other, \uvec{x} is a variable vector representing an arbitrary point on the plane (again as a vector from the origin), and s,t are scalar parameters that vary as the arbitrary vector \uvec{x} varies

the vector equation \dotprod{\uvec{n}}{(\uvec{x} - \uvec{x}_0)} = 0, where \uvec{x}_0 is a vector from the origin to a known point on the plane, \uvec{n} is a known normal vector for the plane, and \uvec{x} is a variable vector representing an arbitrary point on the plane (again as a vector from the origin)
